summary: This is a motion order from the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in the case United States v. Maxwell. The order grants a motion for an attorney to be relieved from representing appellant Ghislaine Maxwell. The document includes a notice of docket activity and identifies the attorneys and court personnel involved in the filing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the appellant in the case United States of America v. Maxwell, and a motion to relieve an attorney representing her was granted.

persons.name: RJL
persons.context: The initials of the judge who issued the motion order granting the attorney's request to be relieved.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: An attorney of record who received electronic notice of the docket activity.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: A deputy clerk for the Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit, associated with the notice and quality control of the filing.

connections.description: David Oscar Markus is listed as an attorney of record who received notice, indicating a legal representation relationship with Maxwell.

events.title: Motion to Relieve Attorney Granted
events.description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit granted a motion for an attorney to be relieved from representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeal.

keyFacts: A motion for an attorney to be relieved from representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her appellate case was granted by the court.
The document is a formal court order from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, case numbers 21-58 and 21-770.
The filing includes standard PACER access fee notices and electronic document stamping procedures.
Attorney David Oscar Markus and Deputy Clerk Bobbi C. Stemheim are identified as recipients of the notice.
